intro: Gymnolomia patens var. abbreviata, commonly known as the short-stemmed gymnolomia, is a variant of the gymnolomia plant characterized by its shorter stems compared to the typical form. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, known for its distinctive floral structures. The leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. This variant is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions. Its blooming period usually occurs during the warmer months, producing showy flowers that attract pollinators.
